data.enText: a talk on a moral or religious subject, usually given by a religious leader during a service
moral advice that a person tries to give you in a long talk

data.chText: 以上各词均指讲话、发言。
data.enText: These are all words for a talk given to an audience.
a formal talk given to an audience

data.chText: 有几个人在婚礼上讲了话。
data.enText: Several people made speeches at the wedding.

data.chText: 通常指大学里的讲座、讲课、演讲：
data.enText: a talk given to a group of people to tell them about a particular subject, often as part of a university or college course
a lecture on the Roman army
a formal speech given to an audience

data.chText: speech指公开或私下场合的讲话均可，而address总是指公开的演讲：
data.enText: A speech can be given on a public or private occasion; an address is always public.
He gave an address at the wedding.

data.chText: 指相当不正式的报告、演讲：
data.enText: a fairly informal session in which sb tells a group of people about a subject

data.chText: 她做了个关于她在中国访问的有趣报告。
data.enText: She gave an interesting talk on her visit to China.
a talk on a moral or religious subject, usually given by a religious leader during a service

example: your preaching is wasted on him

tr: an address of a religious nature (usually delivered during a church service)

value.def: A sermon is a talk on a religious or moral subject that is given by a member of the clergy as part of a church service.
